item.title: Simon add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Folks are usually about as happy as they make their minds up to be." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Simon add a quote by BILL WATTERSON
item.description: "So long, Pop! I'm off to check my tiger trap!" -- BILL WATTERSON

item.title: Simon add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "As far as I'm concerned, if something is so complicated that you can't explain it in 10 seconds, then it's probably not worth knowing anyway." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Simon add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Hey Susie Derkins, is that your face, or is a 'possum stuck in your collar?" -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Simon add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Yakka foob mog. Grug pubbawup zink wattoom gazork. Chumble spuzz. I love loopholes." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Simon add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Boy, there's nothing worse than an inscrutable omen." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Simon add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "But Calvin is no kind and loving god! He's one of the old gods! He demands sacrifice!" -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Simon add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "But for my own example, I'd never believe one little kid could have so much brains!" -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Simon add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Childhood is for spoiling adulthood." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Simon add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Every time I've built character, I've regretted it." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Simon add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Everybody I know fails the acid test of friendship." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Simon add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "From now on, I'm not doing anything I don't want to do! The world owes me happiness, fulfillment and success.... I'm just here to cash in." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Simon add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Girls are like slugsâ€”they probably serve some purpose, but it's hard to imagine what." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Simon add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Happiness is being famous for your financial ability to indulge in every kind of excess." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Simon add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Hello Dad! It is now three in the morning. Do you know where I am? " -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Simon add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "History is the fiction we invent to persuade ourselves that events are knowable and that life has order and direction. That's why events are always reinterpreted when values change. We need new versions of history to allow for our current prejudices." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Simon add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "I go to school, but I never learn what I want to know." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Simon add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "I hate to think that all my current experiences will someday become stories with no point." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Simon add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "I like maxims that don't encourage behavior modification. -Calvin" -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Simon add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "I think life should be more like TV. I think all of life's problems ought to be solved in 30 minutes with simple homilies, don't you? I think weight and oral hygiene ought to be our biggest concerns. I think we should all have powerful, high-paying jobs, and everyone should drive fancy sports cars. All our desires should be instantly gratified. Women should always wear tight clothing, and men should carry powerful handguns. Life overall should be more glamorous, thrill-packed, and filled with applause, don't you think?... Then again, if real life was like that, what would we watch on television?" -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Simon add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "I think nighttime is dark so you can imagine your fears with less distraction." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Simon add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "I try to make everyone's day a little more surreal." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Simon add a quote by Bill Watterson
Simon add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "I won't eat any cereal that doesn't turn the milk purple." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Simon add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "I wonder if you can refuse to inherit the world." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Simon add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "I'd hate to have a kid like me." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Simon add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "I'm a 21st-century kid trapped in a 19th-century family." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Simon add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Miss Wormwood: Calvin, your test was an absolute disgrace! It's obvious you haven't read any of the material. Our first president was not Chef Boy-Ar-Dee and you ought to be ashamed to have turned in such preposterous answers! Calvin: I just don't test well." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Simon add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Ms. Wormwood: Calvin, can you tell us what Lewis and Clark did? Calvin: No, but I can recite the secret superhero origin of each member of Captain Napalm's Thermonuclear League of Liberty. Ms. Wormwood: See me after class, Calvin. Calvin: [retrospectively] I'm not dumb. I just have a command of thoroughly useless information." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Simon add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Hobbes: Jump! Jump! Jump! I win! Calvin: You win? Aaugghh! You won last time! I hate it when you win! Aarrggh! Mff! Gnnk! I hate this game! I hate the whole world! Aghhh! What a stupid game! You must have cheated! You must have used some sneaky, underhanded mindmeld to make me lose! I hate you! I didn't want to play this idiotic game in the first place! I knew you'd cheat! I knew you'd win! Oh! Oh! Aarg! [Calvin runs in circles around Hobbes screaming "Aaaaaaaaaaaa", then falls over.] Hobbes: Look, it's just a game. Calvin: I know! You should see me when I lose in real life!" -- Bill Watterson
